Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the release of Jonel Nuezca by stating that he was freed in January 2020, when in fact he was still in custody.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that Jonel Nuezca was released.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Jonel Nuezca was still in custody at the time the claim was made.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Jonel Nuezca was released based on a misleading video clip, without verifying the information.
Exist alternative explanation: The misleading video clip used in the claim actually refers to the release of suspects in a different case, not Jonel Nuezca's case.
